column2: Tuesday
column3: Tuesday

column2: She has littered the whole estate with execrable names and offensive signs:
column3: She has littered the whole estate with execrable names and offensive signs:

column2: THIS WAY TO THE WHIRLPOOL.
column3: THIS WAY TO THE WHIRLPOOL.

column2: THIS WAY TO GOAT ISLAND.
column3: THIS WAY TO GOAT ISLAND.

column2: She says this park would make a tidy summer resort, if there was any custom for it.
column3: She says this park would make a tidy summer resort, if there was any custom for it.

column2: Summer resort--another invention of hers--just words, without any meaning.
column3: Summer resort-another invention of hers-just words, without any meaning.

column2: What is a summer resort?
column3: What is a summer resort?

column2: But it is best not to ask her, she has such a rage for explaining.
column3: But it is best not to ask her, she has such a rage for explaining.

column2: Friday
column3: Friday

column2: She has taken to beseeching me to stop going over the Falls.
column3: She has taken to beseeching me to stop going over the Falls.

column2: What harm does it do?
column3: What harm does it do?

column2: Says it makes her shudder.
column3: Says it makes her shudder.

column2: I wonder why.
column3: I wonder why.

column2: I supposed it was what the Falls were for.
column3: I supposed it was what the Falls were for.

column2: They have no other use that I can see, and they must have been made for something.
column3: They have no other use that I can see, and they must have been made for something.

column2: She says they were only made for scenery--like the rhinoceros and the mastodon.
column3: She says they were only made for scenery-like the rhinoceros and the mastodon.

column2: I went over the Falls in a barrel--not satisfactory to her.
column3: I went over the Falls in a barrel-not satisfactory to her.

column2: Went over in a tub--still not satisfactory.
column3: Went over in a tub-still not satisfactory.

column2: Swam the Whirlpool and the Rapids in a fig-leaf suit.
column3: Swam the Whirlpool and the Rapids in a fig leaf suit.

column2: It got much damaged.
column3: It got much damaged.

column2: Hence, tedious complaints about my extravagance.
column3: Hence, tedious complaints about my extravagance.

column2: Saturday
column3: Saturday

column2: She engages herself in many foolish things: among others, trying to study out why the animals called lions and tigers live on grass and flowers, when, as she says, the sort of teeth they wear would indicate that they were intended to eat each other.
column3: She engages herself in many foolish things: among others, trying to study out why the animals called lions and tigers live on grass and flowers, when, as she says, the sort of teeth they wear would indicate that they were intended to eat each other.

column2: This is foolish, because to do that would be to kill each other, and that would introduce what, as I understand it, is called "death;" and death, as I have been told, has not yet entered the Park.
column3: This is foolish, because to do that would be to kill each other, and that would introduce what, as I understand it, is called "death;" and death, as I have been told, has not yet entered the Park.

column2: Sunday
column3: Sunday

column2: Pulled through.
column3: Pulled through.

column2: Monday
column3: Monday

column2: It seems a good idea....
column3: It seems a good idea....

column2: She has been climbing that tree again.
column3: She has been climbing that tree again.

column2: Clodded her out of it.
column3: Clodded her out of it.

column2: She said nobody was looking.
column3: She said nobody was looking.

column2: Seems to consider that a sufficient justification for chancing any dangerous thing.
column3: Seems to consider that a sufficient justification for chancing any dangerous thing.

column2: Told her that. The word justification moved her admiration--and envy too, I thought.
column3: Told her that. The word justification moved her admiration-and envy too, I thought.

column2: It is a good word.
column3: It is a good word.

column2: Thursday
column3: Thursday

column2: She told me she was made out of a rib taken from my body.
column3: She told me she was made out of a rib taken from my body.

column2: This is at least doubtful, if not more than that.
column3: This is at least doubtful, if not more than that.

column2: I have not missed any rib....
column3: I have not missed any rib....

column2: She is in much trouble about the buzzard; says grass does not agree with it; is afraid she can't raise it; thinks it was intended to live on decayed flesh.
column3: She is in much trouble about the buzzard; says grass does not agree with it; is afraid she can't raise it; thinks it was intended to live on decayed flesh.

column2: The buzzard must get along the best it can with what is provided.
column3: The buzzard must get along the best it can with what is provided.

column2: We cannot overturn the whole scheme to accommodate the buzzard.
column3: We cannot overturn the whole scheme to accommodate the buzzard.

column2: Saturday
column3: Saturday

column2: She fell in the pond yesterday, when she was looking at herself in it, which she is always doing.
column3: She fell in the pond yesterday, when she was looking at herself in it, which she is always doing.

column2: When night comes I shall throw them out-doors.
column3: When night comes I shall throw them out doors.

column2: Sunday
column3: Sunday

column2: Tuesday
column3: Tuesday

column2: She has taken up with a snake now.
column3: She has taken up with a snake now.

column2: The other animals are glad, for she was always experimenting with them and bothering them; and I am glad, because the snake talks, and this enables me to get a rest.
column3: The other animals are glad, for she was always experimenting with them and bothering them; and I am glad, because the snake talks, and this enables me to get a rest.

column2: Friday
column3: Friday

column2: She says the snake advises her to try the fruit of that tree, and says the result will be a great and fine and noble education.
column3: She says the snake advises her to try the fruit of that tree, and says the result will be a great and fine and noble education.

column2: I told her there would be another result, too--it would introduce death into the world.
column3: I told her there would be another result, too-it would introduce death into the world.

column2: That was a mistake--it had been better to keep the remark to myself; it only gave her an idea--she could save the sick buzzard, and furnish fresh meat to the despondent lions and tigers.
column3: That was a mistake-it had been better to keep the remark to myself; it only gave her an idea-she could save the sick buzzard, and furnish fresh meat to the despondent lions and tigers.

column2: I foresee trouble.
column3: I foresee trouble.

column2: Will emigrate.
column3: Will emigrate.
